intro: Hieracium albovittoides, commonly known as the white-banded hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and can reach heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its leaves are lance-shaped with hairy surfaces, and the flowers are yellow with white markings along the edges. It is an annual or biennial plant that produces seeds through wind dispersal.
